item.title: 11 - Arc 1 Restrospective + Chapter 27
item.description:
It was the heat of the moment

We have a special guest with us: Steven Zuber, co-host of the podcast Not Everything Is A Clue! We're discussing our thoughts on the past Arc 1: Caught in the Web of Mother of Learning, and chapter 27, the beginning of Arc 2.

Next week, we're discussing chapters 28‚Äì30:

  1. Cauldron
  2. The Hunters and the Hunted
  3. A Game of Shops

Apologies for the audio quality.

You can read Mother of Learning in Royal Road and FictionPress, and support the author on Patreon.

Notes:

  • This week, I (Gorky) realized my audio was affected by some high-frequency noise. To salvage the audio, I performed some destructive transformations on it, including filtering out high frequencies. As a result, my side of this week's audio sounds a bit more 'damp', and overall much lower quality than usual. Apologies for the degraded experience. üôá‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

item.title: 01 - Chapters 01‚Äì03
item.description:
Perpetually eye-rolling... in his soul

Enjoy our first episode!

We discuss the first three chapters of Mother of Learning. (Check out our previous prelude/teaser episode if you want more information about what this is all about.)

This guy's internal experience is just a stream of long-suffering sighs.

Next week, we're discussing chapters 4‚Äì5:

  1. Stars Fell
  2. Start Over

You can read Mother of Learning in Royal Road and FictionPress.

You can chat with us on Discord. And leave us comments, questions, and suggestions on Github. üòÖ

  • Racewalking (Video)
  • "Hard"(?) science fantasy story discussed: Ra, by Sam Hughes / qntm
    ([!] spoilers @44:51‚Äì45:34 (skippable by chapter markers))
    • Invisibility Theory appendix.
  • Hard science fantasy recommendation from Griffin: Name of the Wind, by Patrick Rothfuss.
  • Referenced Xvim Chao & Zorian fanart.

Notes:

  • Recommended playback speed is >1.3x üòÖ
  • About half-way into the episode, you may notice a sharp increase in the amount and frequency of 'um's, 'uh's, stutters, pauses, and repetition. That would be the point where I gave up obsessing over every little detail. (This episode needed to come out this year. üò¨) We intend for the next one to be better on that front.
  • While discussing Chapter 3, recording had to be postponed multiple times for personal reasons. I tried to mask this on post, but we may not have done a perfect job picking up every thread we left hanging every time. My bad.

Timestamps:

  • 00:00:00 Intro
  • 00:00:20 Welcome!
  • 00:00:48 Chapter 1 - Good Morning Brother
  • 00:54:57 Chapter 2 - Life's Little Problems
  • 01:45:03 Chapter 3 - The Bitter Truth
  • 02:27:03 Next week's chapters
  • 02:29:50 Outro
item.itunes:subtitle: Perpetually eye-rolling... in his soul
item.itunes:author: Gorky Rojas

item.title: 00 - Prelude/Teaser
item.description:
Welcome to the Shaping Exercises 101 podcast!

No, it's not about fitness and gym tips (apparently). It's an analysis podcast for the web serial (and soon book trilogy) Mother of Learning, written by Domagoj Kurmaic, featuring rational actors trapped in a timeloop!

Griffin is a seasoned, multiple-time reader and fan of the work, who will acompany Gorky through a first-time read, and they'll discuss a few chapters every week.

Hear them say hi in this very, very short teaser, and tune in next week for the first episode, in which we'll be discussing chapters 1‚Äì3:

  1. Good Morning Brother
  2. Life's Little Problems
  3. The Bitter Truth

You can read Mother of Learning in Royal Road and FictionPress.

You can chat with us on Discord. And leave us comments, questions, and suggestions on Github. üòÖ

Until next week! üëã

Notes:

  • Yes, we know that Lord of the Rings takes place over 3 years. Griffin's girlfriend already chastised him for that mistake.
  • We're both total newbs to podcasting, audio editing, and at least one of us to public speaking (and speaking in general). Please excuse awkwardness, nervousness, fumbles, with this in mind for the first couple episodes üôè
  • The intro (and the outro) is an edit of one of the songs from Groundhog Day's OST: "Sometimes People Just Die", by George Fenton

Timestamps:

  • 00:00:00 Intro
  • 00:00:30 Welcome!
  • 00:01:00 Podcast format
  • 00:01:29 About 'Mother of Learning'
  • 00:07:00 Other analysis podcasts
  • 00:08:05 Story arcs
  • 00:08:35 Next week's chapters
  • 00:10:12 Time-loop length?
  • 00:11:42 Wrapping up
  • 00:12:18 Schedule
  • 00:12:55 Outro
